title: Lassar

properties.name: description
properties.value: Lassar was a Zarosian fortress built on what is now known as Ice Mountain. Nothing remains of the fortress; it is assumed to have been destroyed during the God Wars. It may be that the black knights rebuilt the ruins into their own fortress, or built their fortress by cannibalising materials from the ruins, explaining why there are no other traces of ruins on the mountain.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Lassar
Lassar once stood atop Ice Mountain in northern Asgarnia.

Lassar was a Zarosian fortress built on what is now known as Ice Mountain. Nothing remains of the fortress; it is assumed to have been destroyed during the God Wars. It may be that the black knights rebuilt the ruins into their own fortress, or built their fortress by cannibalising materials from the ruins, explaining why there are no other traces of ruins on the mountain.

History[edit | edit source]

An altar in Camdozaal dating back to the Zarosian Empire.

Lassar, during its years of service in the Second and early Third Ages, was a massive fortress on the edge of the Zarosian Empire. Its main features, according to Azzanadra, were impressive spires.[1] It existed atop what is now known as Ice Mountain, a large mountain in northern Asgarnia. At the time, Asgarnia is believed to have been much colder than it is today, yielding snow year-round; yet nearly all of it had been settled by the Zarosians.

Lassar was likely near the borders of the Zarosian Empire, which, at the very least, encompassed the entirety of the Wilderness, Misthalin, and Asgarnia. Lassar most likely served primarily as an outpost, which could protect the area against invaders.

When Zaros was overthrown by the Mahjarrat Zamorak, his kingdom was beset by many religious and racial factions that had been at war with his empire for many years. Lassar was destroyed during the early years of the war, by Saradominists and the Imcando dwarves[2], (who had just allied with Saradomin), led by Yonrith Lovakengj.[3] In exchange for their assistance in laying siege to Lassar, the Imcando dwarves were rewarded with the fortress, and rebuilt it as the dwarven city of Camdozaal.

Today, few traces remain of Lassar, and the fortress itself has been forgotten by all but a few until it was excavated by the player during Below Ice Mountain.

In the Fifth Age, it was discovered that those with knowledge of the Ancient Magicks could teleport to the area where Lassar once stood, using the Lassar Teleport spell, with 72 Magic, two law runes, and four water runes.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Azzanadra, "Desert Treasure", Old School RuneScape. "Do the shining spires of Lassar still stand?"
  2. ↑ Ghost (Ruins of Camdozaal), "Ruins of Camdozaal", Old School RuneScape. "...another dwarven clan has joined the Saradominists. They march upon the fortress as we speak."
  3. ↑ Ghost (Ruins of Camdozaal), "Ruins of Camdozaal", Old School RuneScape. "...Inform him that the enemy leader has been identified... Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj."

{{External|rs}}
{{Map|x=3010|y=3486|height=400|align=right|caption=Lassar once stood atop [[Ice Mountain]] in northern [[Asgarnia]].}}
'''Lassar''' was a [[Zarosian]] fortress built on what is now known as [[Ice Mountain]]. Nothing remains of the fortress; it is assumed to have been destroyed during the [[God Wars]]. It may be that the [[black knights]] rebuilt the ruins into their own [[Black Knights' Fortress (location)|fortress]], or built their fortress by cannibalising materials from the ruins, explaining why there are no other traces of ruins on the mountain.

==History==
[[File:Camdozaal fish altar.png|left|150px|thumb|An [[Altar (Camdozaal)|altar]] in Camdozaal dating back to the [[Zarosian Empire]].]]
Lassar, during its years of service in the [[Second Age|Second]] and early [[Third Age]]s, was a massive fortress on the edge of the [[Zarosian Empire]]. Its main features, according to [[Azzanadra]], were impressive spires.{{CiteNPC |npc=Azzanadra |quote=Do the shining spires of Lassar still stand? |loc=Desert Treasure}} It existed atop what is now known as [[Ice Mountain]], a large mountain in northern [[Asgarnia]]. At the time, Asgarnia is believed to have been much colder than it is today, yielding snow year-round; yet nearly all of it had been settled by the Zarosians.

Lassar was likely near the borders of the Zarosian Empire, which, at the very least, encompassed the entirety of the [[Wilderness]], [[Misthalin]], and Asgarnia. Lassar most likely served primarily as an outpost, which could protect the area against invaders.

When Zaros was overthrown by the [[Mahjarrat]] [[Zamorak]], his kingdom was beset by many religious and racial factions that had been at war with his empire for many years. Lassar was destroyed during the early years of the war, by [[Saradomin]]ists and the [[Imcando dwarves]]{{CiteNPC|npc=Ghost (Ruins of Camdozaal)|quote=...another dwarven clan has joined the Saradominists. They march upon the fortress as we speak.|loc=Ruins of Camdozaal}}, (who had just allied with Saradomin), led by [[Yonrith Lovakengj]].{{CiteNPC|npc=Ghost (Ruins of Camdozaal)|quote=...Inform him that the enemy leader has been identified... Their leader is named Yonrith Lovakengj.|loc=Ruins of Camdozaal}} In exchange for their assistance in laying siege to Lassar, the Imcando dwarves were rewarded with the fortress, and rebuilt it as the dwarven city of [[Camdozaal]].

Today, few traces remain of Lassar, and the fortress itself has been forgotten by all but a few until it was excavated by the player during [[Below Ice Mountain]].

In the [[Fifth Age]], it was discovered that those with knowledge of the [[Ancient Magicks]] could teleport to the area where Lassar once stood, using the [[Lassar Teleport]] spell, with 72 [[Magic]], two [[law runes]], and four [[water runes]].
